class src.database.models.Base(**kwargs: Any)[source]
__init__(**kwargs: Any) → None

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

metadata: ClassVar[MetaData] = MetaData()

Refers to the _schema.MetaData collection that will be used for new _schema.Table objects.

See also

orm_declarative_metadata

registry: ClassVar[_RegistryType] = <sqlalchemy.orm.decl_api.registry object>

Refers to the _orm.registry in use where new _orm.Mapper objects will be associated.

A simple constructor that allows initialization from kwargs.

Sets attributes on the constructed instance using the names and values in kwargs.

Only keys that are present as attributes of the instance’s class are allowed. These could be, for example, any mapped columns or relationships.

class src.repositories.users.UserRepository(session: AsyncSession)[source]

Repository class for managing User entities in the database.

AsyncSession

Initialize the repository with a database session.

async create_user(data: UserCreate, avatar: str = None) → User[source]

Create a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • data (UserCreate) – User creation data.

  • avatar (str, optional) – URL of the user’s avatar. Defaults to None.

Returns:

The created User instance.

Return type:

User

async get_user_by_email(email: EmailStr) → User | None[source]

Retrieve a user by email.

Parameters:

email (EmailStr) – Email address to search for.

Returns:

User instance if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

async get_user_by_username(username: str) → User | None[source]

Retrieve a user by username.

Parameters:

username (str) – Username to search for.

Returns:

User instance if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

User | None

async set_user_verified(email: EmailStr) → None[source]

Mark a user’s email as verified.

Parameters:

email (EmailStr) – Email address of the user to verify.

async update_avatar_url(email: EmailStr, url: str) → User[source]

Update the avatar URL of a user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the user.

  • url (str) – New avatar URL.

Returns:

Updated User instance.

Return type:

User

async set_new_password(password, email) → None[source]

Set a new password for the user.

Parameters:

  • password (str) – New password (hashed).

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the user.

async set_temp_password(password: str | None, email: EmailStr) → None[source]

Set a temporary password for the user (used in password reset flow).

Parameters:

  • password (str | None) – Temporary password (hashed) or None to clear.

  • email (EmailStr) – Email address of the user.

async create(data: dict, user: User)[source]

Create a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Contact data.

  • user (User) – User to whom the contact belongs.

Returns:

The created Contact instance.

Return type:

Contact

async get_all(user: User, query: str | None = None)[source]

Retrieve all contacts for a user, optionally filtered by a search query.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose contacts are retrieved.

  • query (str | None) – Optional search query to filter by name, surname, or email.

Returns:

List of contacts matching the query.

Return type:

list[Contact]

contact_id (int) – ID of the contact.

Returns:

Contact instance if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Contact | None

  • data (dict) – Data to update on the contact.
